Entities

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entities.Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Customer, Discount, Invoice, Job, JobType, Part, PartOrder, Stock, Supplier, Task, User, Vehicle

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item()

    • Method Detail

      • type

        public abstract Item.ItemType type()
        Gets the type of Item subclass. This is used to distinguish between the different Items, especially useful when deciding which table to use when connecting to the database.
        Returns:
        type of Item subclass.

      • insertString

        public java.lang.String insertString()
        Gets a string of column names used for the 'INSERT' SQL statement.
        Returns:
        a comma-separated String of column names.

      • valuesString

        public java.lang.String valuesString()
        Gets a string of values for inserting a new row into the database.
        Returns:
        a comma-separated String of values for columns.

      • setString

        public java.lang.String setString()
        Gets a string for an 'UPDATE' SQL statement.
        Returns:
        a comma-separated string for updating values in the database.

      • IDStr

        public abstract java.lang.String IDStr()
        A String used to identify the Item in its relevant table in the database. For example, for a Customer object, this wold include its CUSTOMER_ID.
        Returns:
        the string used to identify the Item.

      • uniqueStr

        public abstract java.lang.String uniqueStr()
        A String used to check if an Item already exists in the database. For example, for a Customer object, this would include its e-mail. This is because only one Customer can exist per e-mail.
        Returns:
        a String used to check if an Item already exists in the database.

      • map

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map()
        A Map where all the values are stored. The keys for each value are the same as the column names in the appropriate table for the Item.
        Returns:
        the Map where all values are stored.
